raw_text: For both categories the number of target output clusters equals (number of RIPPER output clusters+ the number of documents*0.2) .Although the clustering results with the best set tings for hierarchical and agglomerative clustering were very close with regard to F-score (combining purity and inverse purity, see (Artiles et al, 2007) for a more detailed description), manual inspection of the content of the clusters has revealed big differences between the two approaches
clean_text: For both categories the number of target output clusters equals (number of RIPPER output clusters+ the number of documents*0.2). Although the clustering results with the best set tings for hierarchical and agglomerative clustering were very close with regard to F-score (combining purity and inverse purity, see (Artiles et al, 2007) for a more detailed description), manual inspection of the content of the clusters has revealed big differences between the two approaches.
